I tell you why this happens and exactly how you can become a recovering perfectionist, like me. Let's dive in.
subjects: The Church Of Jesus Christ Of Latter-Day Saints

episodes.title: Irreverent Sessions
episodes.description: Join us for another bonus episode of Irreverent Sessions. Jim and I clink glasses and then talk about... How to pick wine. Long Island Ice Tea. How Molly Mormon Amy was. Our Story. Exploring life outside of the mormon lens (and rules). Jim's life in Hollywood. Jim asking me to marry him while in Italy and why I said no. Sex and exploring your sexuality after mormonism. New York City. Life Coaching Jim. Conflicting Commandments. Jim is a writer. Working for free. And so much more!
subjects: The Church Of Jesus Christ Of Latter-Day Saints

episodes.title: The Irreverent Sessions Big Foot  and Mormon Folklore
episodes.description: This week let's get a little cheeky for our Irreverent Bonus Ep. of Exmormonology. Jim and I talk about all things, well at least a few things, Mormon Folklore. But in all actuality, it kind of all is, isn't it? We discuss, The Three Nephites, Cain being Big Foot, How to test a spirit, and the 1st Vision. Plus a few other tipsy wanderings that you don't want to miss.
subjects: The Church Of Jesus Christ Of Latter-Day Saints

episodes.title: Exmormonology ~ Your Brain on Mormonism
episodes.description: Exmormonology Ep. 029 Your brain is the most powerful tool you have. Are you using it to your advantage or are you letting it run the show with no supervision? If you are serious about improving your exmormon mental health, have a listen. You are the boss of your brain, only you. No one else is responsible for what is going on up in the there, except for you. Spend some time mining around in there and see what is going on. You are worth the time. I give you concrete examples of what this looks like. This is your brain, this is your brain on exmormonism.
subjects: The Church Of Jesus Christ Of Latter-Day Saints

episodes.title: Exmormonology ~ Other People's Feelings
episodes.description: Exmormonology Ep. 28 We have been taught from a young age that we are responsible for other people's feelings, when in connection to something we have done or said. It can feel strange to learn that this is not true. People have thoughts and feelings based on their own life story and experiences. This week in Exmormonology let's talk about what I mean. Great nuggets are toward the end. Also, my new website is up! amyloganlife dot com.
subjects: The Church Of Jesus Christ Of Latter-Day Saints

episodes.title: Exmormonology ~ Post Mormon Exhaustion
episodes.description: Are you feeling exhausted from all things Post Mormon? Let's talk about why and how you can help reduce the tiredness you feel as you unravel your life. Your brain is working overtime trying to solve the puzzle of "WTF just happened." Join me for Ep. 27 of Exmormonology.
subjects: The Church Of Jesus Christ Of Latter-Day Saints

episodes.title: Exmormonology ~ The Emotional Work of Racism
episodes.description: Your brain broke wide open during your faith crisis. You know how that felt, right? Let it break open again if you are new to racism. You know how to feel uncomfortable. You have done it, did it, as you process life after mormonism. Do it again with racism. If you are new to this work, pull the curtain back. Look. Be willing to see it all. This is one of the things I love so much about exmormons, we have felt betrayed by our religious past, this means you most likely want to see what other areas in your life you have not quite seen the full picture. Racism, for me, is one of those areas. How about you? Exmormonology Ep. 26.
subjects: The Church Of Jesus Christ Of Latter-Day Saints

episodes.title: Exmormonology ~ Race and Mormonism and You
episodes.description: Let's look at the foundational teachings from the Book of Mormon that includes racism. Yes, the mormon church has tried to lessen the teachings around "white and delightsome" and dark skin being a curse, but the truth of the matter is that this language is in the Book of Mormon. Let's talk about the how these teachings get into our psyche and influence our thoughts, feelings and actions around racism. Exmormonology Ep. 25.
subjects: The Church Of Jesus Christ Of Latter-Day Saints

episodes.title: The Irreverent Sessions
episodes.description: Amy is drinking a Rosé and James is drinking Bourbon Whiskey and our conversation took us around the block a few times... Mormon Dating Pretty In Pink Sex Before Marriage Purity Culture Young Women's Motto Modesty Boys and their bad thoughts. Uchtdorf 3 year olds bearing testimonies Anti-mormons at General Conference to name a few. You will have to listen to the whole show to hear it all. Enjoy! A & J
subjects: The Church Of Jesus Christ Of Latter-Day Saints
Purity Culture

episodes.title: Exmormonology ~ Anatomy of a Mormon Faith Crisis
episodes.description: Have you ever wondered what stage of your faith crisis you are in? How many stages are there? How did you get to this point in life that everything seems so different now? Let's dive in. Last year we made a docu style video about an Anatomy of a Faith Crisis. This week, I walk you though the video and explain what it feels like in each stage. You can watch the 5 minute video referenced in this podcast by clicking the link below. Exmormonology Ep. 24. https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCWLNS7aHLgQ6UaiJVX8yrDw?view_as=subscriber
subjects: The Church Of Jesus Christ Of Latter-Day Saints

episodes.title: Exmormonology ~ Post Mormon Self Confidence
episodes.description: Post mormon brain often needs a little TLC in the self confidence department. You have busted through a huge paradigm and some of the side effects of this new world view may involve a bit of gun shyness. Let's continue to use that paradigm busting muscle in other areas of your life. You have evidence of your own self confidence, yet when you set out to do something new, all your old stories come to the forefront and try to shut you down. Exmormonology Ep. 23. Let me walk you though why this happens and teach you how to rebuild and boost your self confidence going forward. Take notes!
subjects: The Church Of Jesus Christ Of Latter-Day Saints

episodes.title: The Irreverent Sessions
episodes.description: Welcome to Exmormonology, The Irreverent Sessions. James Rhodimer joins me for a wine reviews, mormon memory lane, and a glimpse into our exmormon life. These "bonus" episodes will be released a couple times a month. And, bonus points If you make it all the way to the end of this episode where the wine has kicked in full tilt and I pretty much slip into giggle mode. Enjoy!
subjects: The Church Of Jesus Christ Of Latter-Day Saints

episodes.title: Exmormonology ~ Post Mormon Pep Talk and Red Boots
episodes.description: There will come a time when you can look back at your initial faith crisis stage of life and laugh at yourself a wee little bit. So, no matter if you are 1 hour into your faith crisis, deer in the head lights stage of things or more of a been at this a while stage of post mormon life, this episode is for you. It is time for a Exmormonology Pep talk and a story of a crazy nervous Amy, first time exmormon meet up and a woman in red boots. Episode 22 of Exmormonology. Let's go!
subjects: The Church Of Jesus Christ Of Latter-Day Saints

episodes.title: Exmormonology ~ Are You Worthy Enough?
episodes.description: Let's talk about the psychology and long lasting effects of mormon worthiness interviews. After decades of needing to measure up, to be worthy enough, to go the LDS temple and progress through all the proper ranks of mormonism, it is no wonder so many mormons and exmormons a like, never feel worthy enough. I also share a personal story that showed me exactly what I thought about my own personal worthiness.
subjects: The Church Of Jesus Christ Of Latter-Day Saints
Psychology

episodes.title: Exmormonology ~ The "S" Word
episodes.description: There are some words that you need to stop staying. I am asking you to never say this one, again. Like forever!
subjects: The Church Of Jesus Christ Of Latter-Day Saints

episodes.title: Exmormonology ~ Mormon Social Distancing and Love Bombs
episodes.description: It is very common to pull back from mormon friends and family, when you are going through a faith crisis, or shortly there after. This is because you start to feel a huge disconnect. You may find yourself going through the motions, until you no longer can. You will know when that happens. Let's talk about it AND mormon love bombs. Have you been a recipient of one?
subjects: The Church Of Jesus Christ Of Latter-Day Saints

episodes.title: Exmormonology ~ Mormons, Funeral Potatoes and Memories
episodes.description: Easter Sunday Thoughts. All the feels. Exmormon ramblings. I am blaming this one on Funeral Potatoes, Andrea Bocelli, and Christian Music.
subjects: The Church Of Jesus Christ Of Latter-Day Saints

episodes.title: Exmormonology ~ What Uchtdorf Said, Unruly Wild Child
episodes.description: Is there a good side when a mormon apostle casts us apostates in a negative light? I think yes. Have a listen and let me know what you think.
subjects: The Church Of Jesus Christ Of Latter-Day Saints

episodes.title: Exmormonology ~ Unorthodox, Mormon General Conference and Fear
episodes.description: On this week's episode of Exmormonology, we talk about... Unorthodox General Conference Mental Health Viktor Frankl Enjoy!
subjects: The Church Of Jesus Christ Of Latter-Day Saints

episodes.title: Exmormonology ~ Calming Your Mind
episodes.description: This week, let's get specific on ways to start managing your mind during this pandemic. Showing up for yourself and learning how to do this work will have lasting ripple effects in your life. Also, are you finding your mormon beliefs around life and death and after life creeping into your brain lately? I want to talk about that too. Learning to manage your mind through crisis, is one of the best gifts you can give yourself.
subjects: The Church Of Jesus Christ Of Latter-Day Saints

episodes.title: Exmormonology ~ Corona Virus Panic
episodes.description: The Human Race has been reminded that life is more uncertain than we wanted to believe. This week, we are taking a break from all things Exmormon and we are talking about healthy ways for you to process the reality of what we are dealing with on a global scale. I know you are experiencing stress and anxiety at levels that feel off the charts. I want to help you reframe and lessen the intense real feelings that we are collectively feeling. Thought work applies to all things, even the confusion and fear of a pandemic.
subjects: The Church Of Jesus Christ Of Latter-Day Saints

episodes.title: Exmormonology ~ Why You Can't Leave The Mormon Church Alone
episodes.description: You hear it all the time exmormon peeps, "You can leave the church, but you can't leave it alone." Right?! I am pretty sure that these words have fallen upon our ears many times over. I am going to tell you exactly why this happens and exactly why it is 100% okay. Let's jump into it in the episode of Exmormonology.
subjects: The Church Of Jesus Christ Of Latter-Day Saints

episodes.title: Exmormonology ~ Trusting Your Post Religious Self
episodes.description: A mormon faith crisis will most likely leave you feeling duped, bamboozled, stunned. How in the world do you trust yourself again after all of this? You did trust yourself. Now what? I am going to tell you exactly what you need to do to rebuild your trusting yourself muscle. It is easier than you think.
subjects: The Church Of Jesus Christ Of Latter-Day Saints

episodes.title: Exmormonology ~ Mormon Expectations & The Manual
episodes.description: Life after mormonism. So many amazing things right? But, there is also a large learning curve to dealing with the fallout regarding friends and family. How do you want people to behave in life, so you feel better? Let's talk all about it. I drop several realistic truth bombs here in this episode of Exmormonology. Let's go there!
subjects: The Church Of Jesus Christ Of Latter-Day Saints

episodes.title: Exmormonology ~ The Residual Effect
episodes.description: Growing up in a high demand, very indoctrinating religion, leaves some residue. In this episode of Ex•mormon•ology we are going to talk about "The Residual Effect" and how many old beliefs sneak up on us when we least expect them. The good news is, you are capable of changing those deep rooted beliefs, one thought at a time.
subjects: The Church Of Jesus Christ Of Latter-Day Saints

episodes.title: Exmormonology ~ Going to Mormon Family Events
episodes.description: This week on Ex•mormon•ology I want to talk to you about something that so many of us find our post mormon selves dealing with....FAMILY and THEIR mormon life. A few weeks ago, I attended my nephew's missionary farewell and setting apart. This meant I had some decisions to make about how I wanted to show up, or even if I wanted to show up at all, for this mormon ritual. I did and here are my thoughts....
subjects: The Church Of Jesus Christ Of Latter-Day Saints

episodes.title: Exmormonology ~ Telling Family and Friends You Have Left The Mormon Church
episodes.description: Deciding to tell your mom (or anyone) about leaving the mormon church can really feel uncomfortable. In this week's Ex•mormon•ology episode, let's talk about how to manage your mind around this stressful situation.
subjects: The Church Of Jesus Christ Of Latter-Day Saints

episodes.title: Exmormonology ~ What Will People Think Now That I Have Left THE Church
episodes.description: Do you feel like you have to keep your mormon faith crisis a secret? "Hiding" what you are going through is a completely normal stage of this process. It is okay to stay put for a bit while you figure out what to do. Let's talk about the process and what you may be thinking and feeling right now.
subjects: The Church Of Jesus Christ Of Latter-Day Saints

episodes.title: Exmormonology ~ The Tornado
episodes.description: For most of us, our mormon faith crisis feels like a tornado just came blowing through our life. Let's talk about slowing down, picking up the pieces and tending to our wounds.
subjects: The Church Of Jesus Christ Of Latter-Day Saints

episodes.title: Exmormonology ~ Are Your Exmormon Thoughts on the Loose?
episodes.description: When you are ready to begin your healing from your mormon faith crisis, taking your power back is the most liberating thing you can do for yourself. It all starts with your thoughts and for most of us, our thoughts are on the loose. Your brain is like an unsupervised child most of the time. Let's dive into your brain and see what is going on in there. I will be teaching you The Model today. This is a tool I used with my clients. It takes practice. You begin to take your power back when you start to manage your mind. This is how it is done.
subjects: The Church Of Jesus Christ Of Latter-Day Saints

episodes.title: Exmormonology ~ Unstuck
episodes.description: It can be a frustrating feeling to spin in limbo land after your mormon faith crisis. It is normal to need time to figure out what steps you want to take next, but it is easy to get stuck in that space. In this episode of Ex•mormon•ology we are going to talk about how to get unstuck and exactly how to start moving forward.
subjects: The Church Of Jesus Christ Of Latter-Day Saints

episodes.title: Exmormonology ~ Grief & Pain After Your Mormon Faith Crisis
episodes.description: Walking through a faith crisis paradigm shift is hard to describe. In its wake can be intense pain and grief. Today we are going to explore ways to process our pain that comes from our mormon faith crisis.
subjects: The Church Of Jesus Christ Of Latter-Day Saints

episodes.title: Exmormonology ~ Giving Yourself Permission
episodes.description: Giving yourself permission to begin a journey that you have no idea where you are going or where you will end up can feel very daunting. Many of us spin in the space right before the beginning, for awhile. Let's talk about a few things you can do to change your thinking that will help you make the decision to begin. It all begins in your brain, with a thought. ~Amy
subjects: The Church Of Jesus Christ Of Latter-Day Saints

episodes.title: Exmormonology ~ The Moment, my Mormon Faith Crisis
episodes.description: Exmormonology Ep. 01 My Mormon Faith Crisis Story. What you are about to or have just recently gone through is HUGE. Experiencing a mormon faith crisis is one of the most painful things you can go through. Your whole spiritual/life paradigm just took a huge tumble, you most likely feel like the rug was pulled out from under your life. Leaving your religion is not for whimps. Let's talk about it.
subjects: The Church Of Jesus Christ Of Latter-Day Saints
